traffic_visible_response: 正在搜索找到 5 篇资料参考Estimates of the number of deaths caused by pollution in China vary. Some of the main data sources are as follows:- **Air Pollution**    - A 2012 study in *The Lancet* estimated that outdoor PM2.5 pollution in China led to 1.2 million premature deaths in 2010.    - The World Health Organization (WHO) stated in 2016 that air pollution was responsible for about 2 million deaths in China per year, with ambient air pollution causing over 1 million deaths and household air pollution from cooking with polluting fuels and technologies causing another million deaths.    - A 2015 study by Berkeley Earth estimated that air pollution in China was responsible for about 1.6 million deaths every year.    - In 2017, the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention reported that 1.24 million people in China died from air pollution.- **Indoor Pollution**    - According to the China Indoor Environment Monitoring Center, the number of deaths caused by indoor air pollution in China reaches 111,000 per year.
